metadata.title: Incident Response Communication Templates
metadata.description: Professional notification templates compliant with GDPR and HIPAA requirements

sources.reference: Articles 33-34, EDPB Guidelines 01/2021 on Examples regarding Data Breach Notification
45 CFR 164.404 - Notification to Individuals, HHS Breach Notification Rule Guidance
NIST SP 800-61r3 Section 3.3 - Incident Response Communication

metadata.usage_note: All templates are starting points and must be customized with specific incident details, organization information, and reviewed by legal counsel before use.

supervisory_authority_notification.delivery_method: Via supervisory authority's designated notification portal or secure email
required_elements: Name and contact details of DPO or contact point
Measures taken or proposed to address breach

template.subject: Personal Data Breach Notification - [ORGANIZATION NAME] - [INCIDENT ID]
template.body:
PERSONAL DATA BREACH NOTIFICATION
Pursuant to Article 33 of the GDPR

1. CONTROLLER INFORMATION
Organization Name: [ORGANIZATION_NAME]
Registered Address: [ADDRESS]
Data Protection Officer: [DPO_NAME]
DPO Contact Email: [DPO_EMAIL]
DPO Contact Phone: [DPO_PHONE]

2. BREACH IDENTIFICATION
Internal Incident Reference: [INCIDENT_ID]
Date Breach Occurred: [BREACH_DATE] (or approximate timeframe if unknown: [TIMEFRAME])
Date Breach Discovered: [DISCOVERY_DATE]
Date Organization Became Aware: [AWARENESS_DATE]

3. NATURE OF THE PERSONAL DATA BREACH

3.1 Description of the Breach:
[Detailed description of what happened - e.g., "On [DATE], our organization detected unauthorized access to our customer database through a compromised employee credential. The investigation revealed that an unauthorized party accessed customer records between [START DATE] and [END DATE]."]

3.2 Categories of Personal Data Concerned:
[Check all that apply and provide details]
☐ Identification data (names, addresses, ID numbers)
☐ Contact details (email addresses, phone numbers)
☐ Financial data (bank account numbers, credit card information)
☐ Online identifiers (IP addresses, cookie identifiers)
☐ Health data
☐ Special categories of data (racial/ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs, genetic data, biometric data)
☐ Other: [SPECIFY]

3.3 Categories of Data Subjects Concerned:
[e.g., "Customers, Employees, Website visitors"]
☐ Customers/Clients
☐ Employees
☐ Prospective customers
☐ Website visitors
☐ Minors
☐ Other: [SPECIFY]

3.4 Approximate Number of Data Subjects Concerned:
[If not yet known, state "Under investigation - estimate will be provided by [DATE]"]
- Number of data subjects: [NUMBER] (or range: [LOW] - [HIGH])
- Number of personal data records: [NUMBER] (or range: [LOW] - [HIGH])

3.5 Type of Breach:
☐ Confidentiality breach (unauthorized access or disclosure)
☐ Integrity breach (unauthorized or accidental alteration)
☐ Availability breach (accidental or unauthorized loss of access)

4. LIKELY CONSEQUENCES OF THE BREACH

[Describe potential impact on data subjects - e.g., "The breach may result in the following consequences for affected individuals:"]

Immediate risks:
- [e.g., "Potential for identity theft or fraud"]
- [e.g., "Financial loss"]
- [e.g., "Unauthorized access to accounts"]

Longer-term risks:
- [e.g., "Ongoing phishing or social engineering attacks"]
- [e.g., "Reputational damage"]

Likelihood assessment: [High/Medium/Low]
Severity assessment: [High/Medium/Low]

5. MEASURES TAKEN OR PROPOSED TO ADDRESS THE BREACH

5.1 Immediate Containment Actions:
- [e.g., "Compromised credentials revoked on [DATE]"]
- [e.g., "Affected systems isolated from network on [DATE]"]
- [e.g., "Unauthorized access terminated on [DATE]"]

5.2 Investigation Actions:
- [e.g., "Forensic analysis initiated on [DATE]"]
- [e.g., "External cybersecurity firm engaged on [DATE]"]
- [e.g., "Log analysis to determine full scope of access"]

5.3 Eradication and Recovery:
- [e.g., "Malware removed and systems rebuilt"]
- [e.g., "All user passwords reset"]
- [e.g., "Multi-factor authentication implemented"]

5.4 Measures to Mitigate Possible Adverse Effects on Data Subjects:
- [e.g., "Affected individuals will be notified by [DATE] with guidance on protective measures"]
- [e.g., "Credit monitoring services offered for 12 months"]
- [e.g., "Dedicated helpline established for inquiries"]
- [e.g., "Enhanced monitoring of affected accounts"]

5.5 Preventive Measures for Future:
- [e.g., "Implementation of mandatory MFA for all accounts"]
- [e.g., "Enhanced security awareness training"]
- [e.g., "Deployment of advanced threat detection systems"]

6. DATA SUBJECT NOTIFICATION

☐ Data subjects have been notified (Date: [DATE])
☐ Data subjects will be notified by [DATE]
☐ Data subjects will not be notified because:
   ☐ Breach unlikely to result in high risk to rights and freedoms
   ☐ Appropriate technical and organizational measures applied (e.g., encryption)
   ☐ Subsequent measures taken ensuring high risk no longer likely
   ☐ Notification would involve disproportionate effort (public communication made instead)
   
Justification: [DETAILED EXPLANATION]

7. CROSS-BORDER BREACH (if applicable)

☐ This breach affects data subjects in multiple EU/EEA member states
Affected jurisdictions: [LIST COUNTRIES]
Lead Supervisory Authority (if applicable): [AUTHORITY NAME]

8. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

[Any other relevant information, including whether notification is delayed beyond 72 hours and reasons for delay]

9. UPDATES

This notification will be updated as additional information becomes available.
☐ Initial notification
☐ Update [NUMBER] - Previous notification sent on [DATE]

Changes in this update: [DESCRIBE CHANGES]

10. CONTACT FOR FURTHER INFORMATION

Data Protection Officer: [DPO_NAME]
Email: [DPO_EMAIL]
Phone: [DPO_PHONE]
Incident Response Contact: [IR_CONTACT_NAME]
Email: [IR_EMAIL]
Phone: [IR_PHONE]

[ORGANIZATION_NAME]
[DATE]
[AUTHORIZED SIGNATORY NAME & TITLE]

template.subject: Important Security Notice Regarding Your Personal Data - [ORGANIZATION NAME]
template.body:
IMPORTANT SECURITY NOTICE
Personal Data Breach Notification

Dear [RECIPIENT_NAME / "Valued Customer"],

We are writing to inform you of a security incident that may affect your personal data held by [ORGANIZATION_NAME]. We take the protection of your personal information very seriously, and we want to provide you with information about what happened, what information was involved, and what we are doing in response.

PLEASE READ THIS NOTICE CAREFULLY.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

1. WHAT HAPPENED

[In clear, plain language without technical jargon]

On [DATE], we discovered that [BRIEF DESCRIPTION]. Our investigation revealed that [WHAT OCCURRED].

Example: "On January 15, 2025, we discovered that an unauthorized individual gained access to our customer database through a phishing attack on one of our employees. The unauthorized access occurred between January 10-14, 2025."

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

2. WHAT INFORMATION WAS INVOLVED

Our investigation indicates that the following types of your personal information may have been accessed:

[Check and list all that apply]
☐ Name and contact information (postal address, email address, phone number)
☐ Date of birth
☐ Government-issued identification numbers [SPECIFY TYPE if possible without creating additional risk]
☐ Financial account information [SPECIFY - e.g., "last 4 digits of payment card"]
☐ Account credentials (username, password)
☐ [Other specific categories relevant to the breach]

[If applicable]: The following information was NOT involved: [LIST]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

3. WHAT WE ARE DOING

We have taken the following actions:

• Immediately secured our systems and terminated the unauthorized access
• Launched a comprehensive investigation with external cybersecurity experts
• Notified relevant data protection authorities
• [Specific action - e.g., "Reset all user passwords"]
• [Specific action - e.g., "Implemented additional security measures including multi-factor authentication"]
• [If applicable: "Arranged for credit monitoring services at no cost to you - details below"]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

4. WHAT YOU CAN DO

We recommend that you take the following steps to protect yourself:

Immediate actions:
☑ Change your password for your [ORGANIZATION] account [if applicable - include link to secure password reset]
☑ If you used the same password on other websites, change those passwords immediately
☑ Be alert for suspicious emails or phone calls asking for your personal information
☑ Do not click on links or open attachments from unknown senders

Ongoing vigilance:
☑ Review your account statements and report any suspicious activity to your bank/card issuer immediately
☑ Monitor your credit reports for any unauthorized activity [if applicable - include how to obtain free credit reports]
☑ Consider placing a fraud alert or security freeze on your credit file [include links to credit bureaus]
☑ Report any suspected identity theft to local law enforcement and your national fraud reporting service

[If credit monitoring offered]:
Complimentary Credit Monitoring:
We are offering [DURATION] months of complimentary credit monitoring and identity theft protection services through [PROVIDER]. To enroll:
• Visit: [SECURE_ENROLLMENT_URL]
• Enter enrollment code: [CODE] (or "Your unique code is included in the enclosed letter")
• Enrollment deadline: [DATE]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

5. FOR MORE INFORMATION

We deeply regret that this incident occurred and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience or concern.

If you have questions or need additional information:

📧 Email: [DEDICATED_INCIDENT_EMAIL]
📞 Phone: [DEDICATED_HOTLINE] (Available [HOURS])
🌐 Website: [INCIDENT_INFORMATION_PAGE]

Data Protection Officer:
[DPO_NAME]
Email: [DPO_EMAIL]
Postal Address: [DPO_ADDRESS]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

6. YOUR RIGHTS

Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the right to:

• Request access to your personal data
• Request correction of inaccurate personal data
• Request deletion of your personal data
• Object to processing of your personal data
• Lodge a complaint with your national data protection authority:
  [RELEVANT_SA_NAME]
  Website: [SA_WEBSITE]
  Contact: [SA_CONTACT_INFO]

For more information about exercising these rights, please contact our Data Protection Officer using the details above.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

We are committed to protecting your personal information and regaining your trust. We will continue to provide updates as our investigation progresses.

Sincerely,

[SIGNATORY_NAME]
[TITLE]
[ORGANIZATION_NAME]

[DATE]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

This notice is being sent to you in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Article 34.

Reference Number: [INCIDENT_ID]

[If substitute notice via media/web posting]: This notice is also available at [URL] and will remain posted for at least 90 days.

media_notification_gdpr.use_case: When Article 34 individual notification would involve disproportionate effort (GDPR Article 34(3)(c))
media_notification_gdpr.delivery_method: Public communication or similar measure through media outlets

template.subject: Important Notice About a Security Incident - [ORGANIZATION NAME]
template.body:
NOTICE OF DATA BREACH

[ORGANIZATION_LETTERHEAD]

[DATE]

[RECIPIENT_NAME]
[ADDRESS_LINE_1]
[ADDRESS_LINE_2]
[CITY, STATE ZIP]

Re: Notice of Data Security Incident

Dear [RECIPIENT_NAME]:

We are writing to notify you of a data security incident that may have involved some of your protected health information. [ORGANIZATION_NAME] takes the privacy and security of your information very seriously. This letter provides information about the incident, our response, and steps you can take to help protect your information.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
WHAT HAPPENED?
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

[Clear description in plain language]

Date of Breach: [DATE_BREACH_OCCURRED or DATE_RANGE]
Date Discovered: [DATE_DISCOVERED]

Example: "On [DATE], we discovered that an unauthorized individual gained access to our electronic medical records system. Our investigation determined that the unauthorized access occurred on or around [DATE or DATE RANGE]."

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
WHAT INFORMATION WAS INVOLVED?
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Our investigation indicates that the following types of your protected health information may have been accessed without authorization:

[Check all that apply - be specific but do not create additional risk by over-disclosure]
☐ Name
☐ Address
☐ Date of birth
☐ Social Security number
☐ Health insurance information (member ID, plan name, group number)
☐ Medical record number
☐ Dates of service
☐ Types of medical services received
☐ Diagnosis codes
☐ Treating physician name(s)
☐ Prescription information
☐ Laboratory test results
☐ Clinical notes
☐ [Other specific categories]

[If applicable]: The following information was NOT involved: [LIST]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
WHAT WE ARE DOING
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Upon discovering this incident, we immediately took the following actions:

• Launched a comprehensive investigation to determine the scope and impact
• Engaged leading cybersecurity experts to assist with our investigation and response
• Notified law enforcement [if applicable]
• Reported this incident to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services as required by law
• [Specific technical action - e.g., "Disabled compromised accounts and reset passwords"]
• [Specific security improvement - e.g., "Implemented enhanced access controls and monitoring"]

To help prevent something like this from happening again, we are:

• [Preventive measure 1 - e.g., "Requiring multi-factor authentication for all system access"]
• [Preventive measure 2 - e.g., "Enhancing employee security training programs"]
• [Preventive measure 3 - e.g., "Deploying advanced threat detection tools"]
• Conducting a comprehensive security assessment of our systems and processes

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
WHAT YOU CAN DO
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

We recommend that you take the following steps to help protect your information:

1. REVIEW YOUR EXPLANATION OF BENEFITS (EOB) STATEMENTS
   Carefully review EOB statements that you receive from your health insurer. If you see any services you did not receive, contact your insurer immediately using the customer service number on your insurance card.

2. MONITOR YOUR MEDICAL RECORDS
   Review your medical records and billing statements for any unfamiliar or unauthorized activity. If you identify any discrepancies, contact your healthcare provider immediately.

3. REVIEW YOUR CREDIT REPORTS
   [If SSN or financial information involved]:
   You are entitled to a free credit report annually from each of the three major credit bureaus. We recommend obtaining and reviewing your credit reports:
   
   • Equifax: www.equifax.com | 1-800-685-1111
   • Experian: www.experian.com | 1-888-397-3742
   • TransUnion: www.transunion.com | 1-800-916-8800
   • Annual Credit Report: www.annualcreditreport.com | 1-877-322-8228

4. FRAUD ALERTS AND SECURITY FREEZES
   [If SSN or financial information involved]:
   You have the right to place a fraud alert or security freeze on your credit file. A fraud alert is free and requires creditors to take extra steps to verify your identity before granting credit. A security freeze restricts access to your credit report. Contact the credit bureaus using the numbers above for more information.

5. REMAIN VIGILANT FOR IDENTITY THEFT OR FRAUD
   • Be alert for phishing emails, phone calls, or text messages asking for your personal or health information
   • Do not provide personal, health, or financial information in response to unsolicited requests
   • Report any suspected medical identity theft to:
     - Your healthcare providers
     - Your health insurance company
     - The Federal Trade Commission: www.identitytheft.gov | 1-877-ID-THEFT (1-877-438-4338)

[IF OFFERING CREDIT MONITORING - If SSN or financial information involved]:

6. COMPLIMENTARY CREDIT MONITORING AND IDENTITY THEFT PROTECTION
   
   As an added precaution, we are offering you complimentary credit monitoring and identity theft protection services for [DURATION - typically 12-24 months] through [PROVIDER_NAME].
   
   These services include:
   • Credit monitoring from all three major credit bureaus
   • Identity theft insurance up to $[AMOUNT]
   • Fraud resolution support
   • [Other specific services]
   
   TO ENROLL:
   • Go to: [ENROLLMENT_URL]
   • Enter your enrollment code: [UNIQUE_CODE] (or "See enclosed letter for your unique code")
   • Complete enrollment by: [DEADLINE_DATE]
   
   Please note: You must enroll by [DEADLINE] to take advantage of these services.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
FOR MORE INFORMATION
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

We sincerely regret any inconvenience or concern this incident may cause you. Protecting your information is a responsibility we take very seriously.

If you have any questions or need additional information, please contact us:

📞 Dedicated Assistance Line: [TOLL_FREE_NUMBER]
   Hours: [DAYS_AND_HOURS - e.g., "Monday-Friday, 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM Eastern Time"]
   
📧 Email: [INCIDENT_RESPONSE_EMAIL]

✉ Mail: [ORGANIZATION_NAME]
       Attention: [INCIDENT RESPONSE COORDINATOR / PRIVACY OFFICER]
       [STREET ADDRESS]
       [CITY, STATE ZIP]

Additional Resources:

• Federal Trade Commission (Identity Theft)
  www.identitytheft.gov | 1-877-ID-THEFT (1-877-438-4338)

• U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (Medical Identity Theft)
  www.hhs.gov/ocr/privacy/hipaa/administrative/breachnotificationrule

• Your State Attorney General's Office: [STATE_AG_CONTACT if applicable]

We remain committed to protecting your information and maintaining your trust.

Sincerely,


[SIGNATURE]
[NAME]
[TITLE - e.g., Chief Executive Officer, Privacy Officer]
[ORGANIZATION_NAME]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
Enclosures: [If applicable - e.g., "Credit monitoring enrollment instructions"]
Reference Number: [INCIDENT_ID]

template.subject: Important Security Incident Information - [ORGANIZATION NAME]
template.body:
INTERNAL NOTIFICATION - CONFIDENTIAL

To: All Employees
From: [CISO / CEO]
Date: [DATE]
Re: Security Incident Information

Dear Colleagues,

I am writing to inform you of a security incident affecting our organization. As we work to address this situation, I want to ensure you have the information you need.

WHAT HAPPENED
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

[Clear, honest description appropriate for employees]

Example: "On [DATE], we discovered that an unauthorized individual gained access to our [SYSTEM]. We immediately activated our incident response procedures and are working with leading cybersecurity experts to investigate and resolve the situation."

WHAT WE ARE DOING
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

• Our incident response team is actively managing this situation
• We have engaged external cybersecurity and legal experts
• We are working closely with [regulators/law enforcement] as appropriate
• We are taking steps to [enhance security/prevent recurrence]

WHAT THIS MEANS FOR YOU
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

[If employee data affected]:
Our investigation indicates that some employee information may have been involved, including [TYPES]. We will be contacting affected employees individually with more information and resources.

[If customers/clients affected]:
We are in the process of notifying affected customers in accordance with legal requirements.

IMPORTANT REMINDERS
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

1. CONFIDENTIALITY
   This information is confidential. Please do not discuss this incident with anyone outside the organization or post about it on social media. All external communications must come from authorized spokespersons.

2. SECURITY VIGILANCE
   • Be extra alert for suspicious emails (phishing attempts may increase)
   • Do not click links or open attachments from unknown senders
   • Report any suspicious activity to IT Security immediately: [EMAIL/PHONE]
   • [Any specific security actions required - e.g., "Change your password using the link in the separate email sent today"]

3. CUSTOMER INQUIRIES
   If customers contact you with questions:
   • Listen with empathy and professionalism
   • Do not speculate or provide details beyond this communication
   • Direct them to: [CUSTOMER HOTLINE / WEBSITE / EMAIL]
   • Notify [CONTACT] that you received an inquiry

4. MEDIA INQUIRIES
   If contacted by media:
   • Do not comment - even "no comment" is a comment
   • Politely refer them to: [MEDIA CONTACT NAME, PHONE, EMAIL]
   • Immediately notify [PR/COMMUNICATIONS CONTACT]

RESOURCES AND SUPPORT
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

• Intranet: [INCIDENT INFORMATION PAGE]

Employee Assistance:
• [If employee data affected]: [SUPPORT RESOURCES]
• General support: [EAP or HR CONTACT]

NEXT STEPS
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

• [Town hall / all-hands meeting if planned]: [DATE/TIME]

I want to thank you for your continued dedication during this challenging time. We are committed to handling this situation with transparency and to protecting our employees and customers.

If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Sincerely,

[NAME]
[TITLE]

"We have [CONTAINED THE INCIDENT / ENGAGED CYBERSECURITY EXPERTS / NOTIFIED AUTHORITIES]. We're also [SPECIFIC PREVENTIVE MEASURES]."

5. What Customers Should Do:
"We recommend that you [KEY PROTECTIVE ACTIONS]. [If applicable: "We're also offering complimentary credit monitoring - you should have received information about enrolling."]"

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Q: Am I affected?
A: "We sent notification letters to all individuals whose information was involved. If you received a letter, your information was affected. If you haven't received a letter and it's been [X days] since we began mailing notifications, your information was likely not involved. However, I can verify for you - may I have [IDENTIFYING INFORMATION]?"

[Then check affected individual list and confirm]

Q: What specific information of mine was involved?
A: [If you can verify]: "According to our records, the following types of your information were involved: [LIST]. The following were not involved: [LIST]."

[If you cannot determine]: "The notification letter includes the types of information that were involved. If you need more specific information about your account, I can connect you with [DEPARTMENT/PERSON]."

Q: How did this happen?
A: "Our investigation determined that [BRIEF, UNDERSTANDABLE EXPLANATION without excessive technical detail]. We've taken steps to prevent this from happening again, including [PREVENTIVE MEASURES]."

Q: When did this happen? When did you discover it?
A: "The incident occurred [on DATE / between DATES]. We discovered it on [DISCOVERY_DATE] and immediately began our investigation and response."

Q: Why am I just finding out now?
A: "We wanted to provide you with accurate information about what happened and what information was involved. This required a thorough investigation. We are notifying you [within the timeframe required by law / as soon as we completed our investigation]."

Q: Was my [SPECIFIC DATA TYPE - SSN, credit card, password, etc.] compromised?
A: [If YES]: "Yes, [DATA TYPE] was among the information involved. That's why we strongly recommend [SPECIFIC PROTECTIVE ACTION] and [IF APPLICABLE] why we're offering credit monitoring services."

[If NO]: "No, [DATA TYPE] was not involved in this incident."

[If UNKNOWN]: "I don't have information about specific data elements for your account right now. Let me connect you with [SPECIALIST] who can provide more detail."

Q: What are you doing to protect me?
A: "We've taken several steps: [LIST KEY ACTIONS]. [If applicable]: We're also offering you [CREDIT MONITORING / IDENTITY PROTECTION] services at no cost for [DURATION]."

Q: How do I enroll in the credit monitoring you mentioned?
A: "Your notification letter includes a unique enrollment code and instructions. You can enroll by [METHOD - visiting WEBSITE, calling NUMBER]. The enrollment deadline is [DATE]. If you don't have your letter or need a new code, I can help you with that."

[Then provide enrollment assistance or escalate as needed]

Q: Will you pay for damages if I'm a victim of identity theft?
A: "[If identity theft insurance included]: The credit monitoring services we're offering include identity theft insurance up to $[AMOUNT]. [If not included]: If you experience identity theft as a result of this incident, please contact us at [CONTACT] and we'll work with you on a case-by-case basis." 

[ESCALATE to supervisor/legal for commitments beyond standard offering]

Q: I've already seen fraudulent charges / suspicious activity!
A: "I'm very sorry to hear that. Please immediately contact your bank/credit card issuer to report the fraudulent activity and dispute those charges. Also report this to [LOCAL POLICE / FRAUD REPORTING SERVICE]. Please document this and send details to [EMAIL/METHOD] so we can track potential impacts from this incident."

[ESCALATE per procedure]

Q: Are you going to reimburse me for [CREDIT MONITORING / CREDIT FREEZE / TIME SPENT]?
A: "We're providing complimentary credit monitoring and identity protection services. [If other requests]: Let me note your request and connect you with [SUPERVISOR/DEPARTMENT] who can discuss this with you."

[ESCALATE - do not make commitments]

Q: Can I close my account / stop using your services?
A: "I understand your concern. If you'd like to discuss your account options, I can connect you with [DEPARTMENT]. However, I want to assure you that we've taken significant steps to prevent this from happening again, including [PREVENTIVE MEASURES]."

[Offer to transfer if customer insists, but attempt to retain with empathy]

Q: I want to speak to [CEO / YOUR BOSS / A LAWYER].
A: "I understand this is concerning. I'm here to help and provide you with all the information and support I can. [If legitimate need for escalation]: I can connect you with [SUPERVISOR/SPECIALIST]. [If general frustration]: Is there something specific I can help you with right now?"

Q: Are you going to get sued? Will there be a class action?
A: "I can't comment on potential legal matters. What I can tell you is that we're focused on supporting affected individuals and preventing future incidents. Is there something specific I can help you with regarding your information?"

[Do not speculate about legal matters]

Q: Was this an inside job / employee?
A: "Our investigation looked at all possible scenarios. I can't share specific details about the investigation, but I can tell you [WHAT YOU CAN CONFIRM - e.g., "it was external unauthorized access"] and that we're working with law enforcement."

[Do not speculate or provide investigation details not approved for disclosure]

Q: Has this happened before?
A: [If NO previous incidents]: "No, this is not something we've experienced before."

[If there have been previous incidents - rare to admit]: "We've experienced security challenges in the past, and each time we've learned and improved our security. This incident has prompted additional enhancements to our security program."

[Generally emphasize forward-looking improvements]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
WHAT NOT TO SAY
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

❌ "It's not that bad"
❌ "It wasn't our fault" (even if third party responsible)
❌ "Everyone gets hacked"
❌ "Your information probably wasn't accessed" (if they received notification)
❌ "I don't know" (Instead: "Let me find that information for you" or "Let me connect you with someone who can help with that")
❌ Speculation about causes, legal liability, or consequences
❌ Blame directed at customers (e.g., "You should have used a stronger password")
❌ Technical jargon that customers won't understand

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
ESCALATION CRITERIA
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Escalate immediately to [SUPERVISOR/SPECIALIST] if:
☐ Customer reports actual identity theft or fraud
☐ Customer threatens legal action
☐ Customer is media/journalist
☐ Customer is extremely upset (abusive, threatening self-harm, etc.)
☐ Customer asks questions not covered in FAQs
☐ Customer requests financial compensation beyond standard offering
☐ You're unsure how to respond

Escalation Contact: [NAME, PHONE, EMAIL]
After-Hours Escalation: [CONTACT]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

For every inquiry, document in [CRM SYSTEM]:
☑ Customer name and contact info
☑ Date/time of inquiry
☑ Channel (phone/email/chat/in-person)
☑ Summary of inquiry/concern
☑ Information provided
☑ Actions taken
☑ Escalation (if applicable)
☑ Follow-up needed

Use incident tag: [TAG_NAME]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
ADDITIONAL RESOURCES
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Internal:
• Incident Response Hotline: [PHONE]
• Internal FAQ: [INTRANET LINK]
• Supervisor on Duty: [CONTACT]

Customer Resources:
• Notification Letter: [LINK TO SAMPLE]
• Credit Monitoring Enrollment: [WEBSITE, PHONE]
• Incident Information Page: [PUBLIC WEBSITE]
• Dedicated Email: [EMAIL]

External Resources (for customer referral):
• FTC Identity Theft: www.identitytheft.gov | 1-877-ID-THEFT
• Credit Bureaus: [CONTACT INFO]
• [Applicable data protection authority]

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

Remember: 
• Stay calm and professional
• Be empathetic - this is stressful for customers
• Stick to approved talking points
• Document everything
• Escalate when appropriate
• You are representing the organization - your professionalism matters

Questions about these talking points?
Contact: [INCIDENT RESPONSE TEAM CONTACT]

usage_guidelines.customization_required: All templates are starting points and must be customized with specific incident details, organization information, and approved by legal counsel before use.
usage_guidelines.legal_review: Always have legal counsel review customer-facing notifications before sending, especially for GDPR and HIPAA notifications.
usage_guidelines.plain_language: Write all customer/individual notifications in clear, plain language avoiding technical jargon.
usage_guidelines.timeliness: Adhere strictly to regulatory timelines (GDPR 72 hours, HIPAA 60 days).
usage_guidelines.documentation: Retain copies of all notifications sent and document send dates/methods for compliance records.
usage_guidelines.accuracy: Only include information that has been verified through investigation - do not speculate.
usage_guidelines.empathy: All customer-facing communications should express genuine concern and empathy while remaining professional.
usage_guidelines.consistency: Ensure all notifications (individual, media, internal) contain consistent information to avoid confusion.
usage_guidelines.contact_information: Always provide clear, accessible contact information for questions and support.
usage_guidelines.updates: If situation evolves after initial notification, provide updates to affected parties and regulators as needed.
